questions.question: 1. What is the time complexity of Radix Sort? (n is the number of elements, d is the maximum number of digits in any element)

explanations.a: Correct. Radix sort processes each element (n) for each digit position (d), resulting in O(n*d) time complexity.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The operations are multiplicative, not additive, across digits and elements.
explanations.c: Incorrect. O(n^2) is the complexity of comparison-based sorts like bubble sort, not radix sort.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The complexity depends on both the number of elements and digits, not just digits alone.

questions.question: 2. Radix Sort has O(1) space complexity.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Radix sort requires auxiliary arrays or buckets for storing elements during sorting, so it is not O(1).
explanations.b: Correct. Radix sort has O(n+k) space complexity, where n is the number of elements and k is the radix (typically 10), due to the auxiliary buckets needed.
